marklogic.body:
Pretty sure everyone has someone to root for this weekend.
With the difference between #17 Luther (1603) and #23 Penn State (1589) rather slight, everyone in between has teams they've played against that can slightly impact those rankings (no?). UConn didn't play last weekend, but all the shenanigans down at Easterns and elsewhere dropped them 5 Spots and 13 points in PR.
Even NE Open matters, where most of the OV and AC have run into UConn and/or Dartmouth at some point. UNCW's heavy schedule even includes games against the likes of URI, SUNY-Buffalo, and Gtown (who's at Roll Call).
Needs clarification, but would Luther need to absolutely crush the rest of the competition at Someday if they can't knock Off Minnesota or Wisconsin?
And Chicago should be a bloodbath with those 1v2 games on Saturday. Michigan State certainly knows that if they win that tourney, they've likely wrestled a strength bid back to the GL.
(sorry if any incorrect assumptions, it's Friday).

object.displayName: Comment on Bid Watch 2012 - College Open (Update 3/21) by Brosev

marklogic.displayName: Brosev commented on Bid Watch 2012 - College Open (Update 3/21)
